title: Pensioner, 74, died after getting trapped behind kitchen unit 'while searching for mouse'
text:
A pensioner died after becoming stuck behind a kitchen unit while searching for a mouse, an inquest has heard.

Carole Williams, 74, died from "compression in a confined space" after falling down a gap between two worktops in June this year.

Her friends suggested she may have been trying to find a mouse which had got into her property in Clifton, Bristol, where she lived alone.

Assistant coroner Dr Peter Harrowing gave a verdict of accidental death today.

He told Avon Coroner's Court: "It may be she was searching for the mouse or something else. She was unable to escape from that location and it was there she sadly died."

Officers from Avon and Somerset Constabulary did not find Ms Williams during an initial search of her home and only came across her body when carrying out a second more thorough search later that day, The Telegraph understands.

It is believed she had stood on a chair and reached down behind her fridge, getting stuck in a gap just a few inches wide between two kitchen units.

Police launched a missing person appeal was launched in the early hours of June 24, two days after she was last seen by friends.
